150455428.review:
This game has changed me as a person.

I have been recently suffering a lot in my life over the past few months, and also through the past few years. From even when  I was 7 years old I was bullied constantly in school and found it very hard to fit in and make friends. This meant that for much of my life when I was young, I had not been able to even play with people and was just on my own all the time, the only people I talked to was my family or myself. No one showed up to my birthdays or celebrations, no one showed up to when I was sad, no one cared for me. When I was about to enter High School I also lost my girlfriend, we parted ways just before we left and she was really the only person I had left to talk to.

High School was not easy either. I was constantly bullied there too and found no one to even be around. My life was a mess and I even contemplated suicide. My teachers drove me out of it and I seemed to get better, but I still had no friends at all to play with or even interact with. But when I got home, things were different. I used to sit down and watch people like Jacksepticeye and Markiplier play this game, and it made me very happy as a person when all my life at this point had been terrible. Every day I would come and watch at least one Goat Sim video from them and I always wanted to buy it. It made me laugh and be happy when the day was terrible. My life took more spirals after that and I found myself in the same position I was, contemplating taking my life with no one to talk to and losing another lover and even losing my best friends. Making matters worse I lost my grandfather not too long ago and things were not going well at all in my family. I was even diagnosed with depression which made things worse.

Yesterday as of writing this, one of my only friends gifted me this after I longed to play it for so long. I was much older now and did not thing I would enjoy the game as much as I did back when I watched it in 2018, but I was so wrong. It was as funny as I remember and I really enjoyed playing it, all the wacky things happening reminded me a lot of Garry's Mod or other Sandbox games. Even after months, even YEARS of bad things that have happened to me, this game made me overlook those and have a better reach on things, enjoying every second I played as there was so much to do, see and laugh about in this game with its quirky physics and humour.

I have only played 90 minutes of the game so far, but the impression it left on me today was more than just something simple. It taught me that even when things are tough and going to absolute hell in your life, there is always a light at the end of the tunnel and enjoyment to be had by yourself when you are sad. Thank you Goat Simulator, and the community for creating this game and keeping it alive.

150357375.review:
Goat Simulator, the game that made me question the meaning of life and the profound wisdom of goats. It's like the developers took a random word generator, got 'goat,' and said, "Let's roll with it."

The graphics are intentionally wonky, turning goats into four-legged tornadoes of destruction. It's like the goats themselves coded the game and decided, "Hey, let's make everything look as bizarre as possible."

The gameplay is a riot of goat-fueled chaos, where headbutting, licking, and defying gravity are the primary skills. It's like being a goat with ADHD, wandering around a world that's as nonsensical as a cat video on the internet.

The story is... well, let's not pretend Goat Simulator has a story. It's more of a goat manifesto, where the goal is not to complete missions but to create as much mayhem as possible while bleating like a rebellious farm animal.

In conclusion, Goat Simulator is not just a game; it's a hilarious experiment in goat absurdity, a reminder that sometimes gaming is at its best when it doesn't take itself too seriously. So, grab your goat horns, embrace the chaos, and get ready for a gaming experience that's weirder than dreaming of goats doing stand-up comedy.

150341699.review:
Goat Simulator is the game I never knew I goat to play, and now I can’t stop bleating about it! Picture this: a majestic goat on a quest for world domination. Forget about being a superhero or a knight in shining armor; I'm a goat with a mission to cause chaos. The physics are as believable as a goat balancing on a unicycle while juggling watermelons—absolutely ridiculous and hilariously entertaining.

I spent hours head-butting unsuspecting pedestrians, causing absolute pandemonium in a virtual world. The glitches are the cherry on top; my goat once flew into space after licking a rocket, which was both confusing and oddly satisfying. And let’s talk about the soundtrack—pure goat symphony! Every time I rammed into something, it felt like the game was composing a masterpiece.

The developers nailed the goat simulator experience; it’s like they’ve infiltrated a goat’s secret diary and turned it into a video game. The bugs are as common as finding hay in a barn—expected, but they add to the charm. Plus, who needs polished graphics when you can have a goat doing yoga mid-air? It's a symphony of absurdity that’s strangely addictive.

If you ever wondered what being a goat with a mischievous streak feels like, Goat Simulator is your ticket to goat glory. Trust me, you haven’t truly lived until you’ve head-butted a gas station and caused a chain reaction of explosions as a goat. It’s the game that makes you question everything you thought you knew about goats and video games—a bleating good time!

Do you harbor a deep, unspoken love for goats? Ever daydreamed about what it would be like to step into those cloven hooves and embrace the caprine way of life? Well, my fellow bleat enthusiast, hold onto your horns, because Goat Simulator is here to make your goat-filled dreams come true!

In this utterly bonkers game, you get to choose your very own goat persona and engage in all the peculiar antics that goats are known for—or, honestly, maybe some things that goats should never attempt. Whether you're itching to experience the thrill of being a real-life goat, munching on grass and headbutting things, or if you prefer to take a wild detour from typical goat behavior, Goat Simulator has got something to tickle every capricious fancy.

So, whether you're in it for the authentic goaty experience or ready to let your inner rebel goat run wild, this game promises a side-splitting journey filled with all things goat, and then some. Grab your goat gear and get ready to bleat, butt heads, and have a hoofin' good time like no other!

146855915.review:
[h1] Goat Simulator [/h1]

Graphics: ★★★☆☆
The graphics in Goat Simulator are intentionally designed to be purposely glitchy and exaggerated. While they may not be visually impressive in terms of realism, they add to the game's unique and comedic style. The intentionally awkward animations and quirky environments contribute to the overall humor of the game.

Gameplay: ★★★★☆
Goat Simulator offers a highly entertaining and unconventional gameplay experience. As a goat, players are free to explore an open-world environment and cause chaos by performing hilarious stunts, interacting with objects, and even causing destruction. The sheer absurdity of the game makes it a fun and enjoyable experience, even though it lacks depth in terms of objectives and progression.

Replayability: ★★★★☆
The game's open-world design and the sheer number of bizarre actions players can perform make Goat Simulator highly replayable. Players can continuously find new ways to wreak havoc and discover hidden secrets and Easter eggs. However, the novelty of the gameplay may wear off for some players after a while.

Humor: ★★★★★
Humor is the defining aspect of Goat Simulator. The game embraces absurdity and satire, with countless hilarious moments and references. From making the goat fly with a jetpack to headbutting objects in the environment, the game consistently delivers laugh-out-loud moments that keep players entertained.

Overall Rating: ★★★★☆
Goat Simulator is a game that shouldn't be taken too seriously. While it may not have groundbreaking graphics or complex gameplay mechanics, it excels in providing a unique and hilarious experience. It's a great choice for players looking to have some mindless fun and enjoy a game that doesn't take itself seriously.

Goat Simulator is basicly a goated version of GTA.
The village you walk around in consists of the regular parts of the average Drenthe hamlet: A bunch of water slides, a gas station, an enormous Low Gravity Testing Facility, a towering crane, a handful of trampolines, you get the idea.
The village is small and peaceful, so naturally your mission is to unleash chaos and terror on its unsuspecting residents, bleating loudly.

The game also works well on a steam deck: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rIoCs49PbJw

Goat Sim's controls are surprisingly good. If you have never seen a goat punished, now is finally your chance. The controls are simple and limited to a few buttons.
The most important action is undoubtedly the 'bite' function, which attaches your tongue to whatever is in front of you.
Basketball? To lick.
Truck at high speed? To lick.
Peacefully dining family? All lick.
In addition, the game gives some assignments that can be completed for even more points, but the focus is really on humor and on achieving achievements and thus unlocking a friend or 2. There is not really a goal in Goat Simulator. .

145723367.review:
[b] Sanctum 3 died for this. GTFO Coffee Stain. [/b]

"Goat Simulator," the game that's about as entertaining as watching paint dry, but with more goats. It's a testament to the absurdity of the gaming industry that this abomination exists, and I can't help but lament that it's the harbinger of doom for any potential "Sanctum 3," which would have been a much-needed revival for a series that the developers sadly abandoned.

First things first, let's talk about "Goat Simulator" itself. Or should I say, "Bloat Simulator"? Because this game is the bloated carcass of creativity, a festering mess of glitches and pointless mayhem. It's like someone threw a bunch of random ideas into a blender and hit the "make a game" button. Yes, let's make a game where you play as a goat, and your main goal is to cause as much chaos and destruction as possible. How innovative! Except not.

The gameplay is a slap in the face to anyone who has ever enjoyed a well-crafted video game. It's a series of mind-numbingly repetitive tasks like headbutting people and licking objects. I mean, really? Is this what we've come to? Is this the pinnacle of entertainment? I'd rather watch a goat eat grass for an hour, at least that has some authenticity.

The physics engine in this game is about as stable as a house of cards in a hurricane. You'll find yourself flying through the air, getting stuck in walls, and glitching through the scenery more often than actually accomplishing anything meaningful. But hey, that's part of the charm, right? Wrong.

And the bugs! Oh, the bugs! It's like the developers took pride in creating a game that's more broken than my dreams of ever enjoying it. From goats getting stuck in walls to bizarre and hilarious graphical glitches, "Goat Simulator" is a showcase of how not to make a game.

I'm absolutely livid that "Sanctum 3" never had the chance to come to life, all thanks to the absurdity of "Goat Simulator" and its creators at Coffee Stain! It's infuriating to think that such a promising game got robbed of its existence. Why on earth did Goat Simulator even steal the spotlight? What a disgrace!

"Sanctum 3" deserved to shine and continue its legacy, but instead, it got overshadowed by a senseless goat simulation game. It's not that I want to see any game or its developers fail, but this situation makes my blood boil. Certain franchises, like "Sanctum," should have been allowed to gracefully evolve and thrive, but they were unjustly derailed by the antics of Goat Simulator and its developers. It's a mourning of lost potential, and I vehemently condemn this injustice!

In conclusion, "Goat Simulator" is a train wreck of a game that should serve as a cautionary tale for anyone thinking of venturing into the world of game development. It's a sorry excuse for entertainment, and I can't help but mourn the missed opportunity for "Sanctum 3" to bring new life to a franchise that deserved better.

So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my grandson for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my grandson since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my grandson closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my grandson many happy memories.

144666105.review:
I don't know if this game needs a review at this point. My experience with this game is almost entirely on mobile and then for a bit on Steam Deck.  My Thoughts

- I first got this game on mobile (Android) and you were able to access the extra "chapters"/DLCs.  I thought that the mobile version was easier to navigate to be honest.  The interface made it easier to switch between goats and DLC.
- Can be glitchy... well known about this game... can add to the humor
- Silly - I love it because its so silly and you can create pure chaos with low stakes.  I'd consider this open-world because there isn't a narrative but fun quests you can complete.
- Accessibility - Developers can add more on this - the font size is a bit small and since voice boxes aren't narrated you have to be able to read the voice bubbles for NPCs.

If you are fairly new to gaming, want something a bit more open than your typical point & Click Adventure this is the game for you.  They have added a few added chapters - Space, University, City, Zombies, Holiday editions.  

I recommend the mobile version over the Deck Version. (Although the font is much smaller!)

🐐 Five Hooves of Hilarity! 🐐

As a seasoned goat with a discerning palate for top-tier entertainment, I must say that Goat Simulator has revolutionized the gaming world... for us goats, at least! This game is the GOAT of goat experiences – I can finally live out my wildest dreams of wreaking havoc in a world that just can't comprehend my majestic caprine charm.

The attention to detail is udderly impressive! From the wobbly physics that make me look like a ballet-dancing goat on roller skates, to the tongue physics that allow me to perform advanced goat yoga poses with a single click, every aspect of my goat existence has been accurately captured.

I particularly enjoyed the high-octane thrill of headbutting unsuspecting villagers into the stratosphere. It's the perfect stress-reliever after a long day of grazing and staring contemplatively into the distance. And don't even get me started on the "Goat MMO Simulator" expansion – I've never felt more empowered as a heroic goat wizard battling evil creatures with my goat magic.

Whether I'm leaping off ramps, causing traffic chaos, or just taking a leisurely stroll through town with a bucket stuck on my head (don't judge, it's a fashion statement), Goat Simulator never fails to deliver a side-splitting, tail-wagging good time. Kudos to the developers for crafting a game that truly understands the heart and soul of us goats. It's baaaa-rilliant!

So, fellow goats and aspiring goats alike, if you're looking for a game that captures the essence of goat life and lets you unleash your inner horned hero, look no further. Goat Simulator gets my wholehearted endorsement – it's a bleating good time that'll have you saying, "You've goat to be kidding me!" 🐐🎮

143501721.review:
[h1] Goat Simulator: Hilariously Buggy Fun! [/h1]

Alright, let's talk about Goat Simulator – the game that's more of a joke than a serious gaming experience. But you know what? It's one heck of a game! Sure, it's quirky and deliberately unpolished, and you'll encounter plenty of bugs along the way. But that's all part of the charm, trust me.

So, there's no grand story here about why we're playing as a goat with murderous tendencies, but that's not the point. It's all about causing mayhem in a seemingly peaceful small-town setting. And boy, do you get to cause chaos! Picture this: I used my goat's stretchy tongue to grab a poor bystander, climbed a massive crane (with the weirdest animation ever), and then took a dramatic leap off the top with my unwilling captive. Slow motion enabled, of course, to savor every hilarious moment of our flailing.

The game doesn't take itself seriously at all, and that's what makes it a blast. You've got optional achievements that are pure goofiness, like mashing the 1 key to hear all the ridiculous goat noises. And let's not forget the high-score challenges that push you to run around like a goat in a china shop – as if we needed an excuse for that!

The world is your playground, filled with collectibles and secret surprises. I mean, you stumble upon a goat kingdom and gain magical powers – how cool is that? And don't get me started on the uncontrollable jetpack; it's an adventure in itself.

Now Goat Simulator has its fair share of bugs, and I mean a lot of them. But guess what? They're part of the fun! Developer Coffee Stain decided not to fix most of them, claiming they're hilarious, and I agree. There's something oddly entertaining about clipping through walls or getting stuck in objects, especially when you can't die or fail.

And let's not forget the Steam Workshop support, which means even more insanity with community mods. It's a never-ending stream of wacky content, like wiggling goat legs. Yep, you heard me right.

All in all, Goat Simulator may not be your traditional game, but it's a damn good time. The map is packed with jokes and bugs that'll leave you in stitches. It's like a tribute to all the crazy physics mishaps we've seen in other games, wrapped up in a world designed to be delightfully broken.

So, if you're up for some laugh-out-loud moments and want to experience gaming gone wild, give Goat Simulator a go. Just remember, it's not a serious game, but it's a hilarious and entertaining one.

140639089.review:
[u][b]-Quick Review-[/b][/u]
I've seen a lot of simulation games out there, Flight simulator being the first, then there was Tabletop simulator, Battle simulator, Prison simulator, Dating simulators, Farming Simulators, Truck Simulators...

But pause... have you ever wanted to be a goat? Do you even know what goats do? In Goat simulator you will definitely, probably, maybe, absolutely, will experience something that Goats actually do.

Goat Simulator was released in 2014 by Coffee Stain Studios, and has goats in it.

[u][b]Review Video:[/b][/u]
If you don't like reading, or are curious about watching gameplay check out my video here:
https://youtu.be/eHKXQn0nnh4

[u][b]-Detailed breakdown review-[/b][/u]
[b]Story:[/b] So Goat Simulator *IS* technically a simulation game, but it's done in a very hyperbolic sense of the Genre. You play as a Goat, dropped into the world, and can do goat things like standing in a fenced off area and making goat noises, you can also jump the fence and kick or lick pedestrians.

You can play in traffic and get hit by cars...
...And you'll be fine, because the Goat in Goat simulator is invincible. Throw yourself from the highest building, jump into any peril, thou shalt survive  with nay a hair out of place.

Where is the fun in goat simulator? In causing hysteria and mayhem. In completing in-game objectives. In hunting for and completing steam achievements. In unlocking different Goats for doing special stuff in-game. in collecting all the goat statues around town.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2932769694

[b]Gameplay:[/b] You can play with a controller or keyboard and mouse. I played with a keyboard, so I moved with good ol' WASD, sprint with shift, jump with space bar, you use your special move with R, headbutt with left click, Rotate camera right right click, lick with E, Ragdoll with Q, Toggle on Slow Motion with F, and most importantly, Baa with the number 1.

Your objectives are whatever you want them to be. That's one of the best parts of Open World Sandbox Genre games, but as I mentioned earlier, you can follow the task objectives and do whatever you want, I personally went Achievement hunting which actually kinda taught me the mechanics of the game, I couldn't figure out how to Manual or do a flip until looking it up.

[spoiler](Manual by pressing forward and backward rapidly)[/spoiler]
[spoiler](Flip by Jumping and then using the camera rotate button/click)[/spoiler]

The basic game comes with two different zones, tons of references in those areas, and Goat Simulator: MMO Simulator... Which is by far my favorite part of the game seeing as I can't seem to escape playing MMORPG's.

At some point I'm sure I'll pick up the other DLC.

[b]Conclusion:[/b] I've enjoyed Goat Simulator, I'm glad there are games out there which don't take themselves too seriously. I'm also learning that Coffee Stain Studios has been making a lot of different games I've been playing lately.

If Goat simulator seems a bit too crazy, it might be a pass... But with most of us on the internet, Goat simulator embodies what we've all been growing up with for a long time.

Of course I love achievement hunting  too... but sadly I'll never get all the achievements and 100% in this game because I suck at flappy [strike]bird[/strike] goat.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2932597332

139802572.review:
Goat Simulator is an absolutely bonkers game that embraces pure, unadulterated madness. If you're looking for a gaming experience that defies logic, revels in absurdity, and keeps you laughing until your sides hurt, then this game is an absolute must-play.

First things first, don't expect a deep storyline or complex objectives in Goat Simulator. Instead, prepare yourself for a hilarious sandbox filled with endless possibilities and a goat as your unconventional protagonist. From the moment you take control of your four-legged mayhem-maker, you're thrown into a world where physics take a backseat, and chaos reigns supreme.

The sheer amount of absurdity and comedic elements packed into Goat Simulator is mind-boggling. Whether you're licking objects to attach them to your goat tongue or launching yourself into the sky with the power of an explosive jetpack, every moment is a laugh-out-loud experience. The intentionally glitchy mechanics only add to the charm, resulting in unpredictable and downright hilarious situations at every turn.

Exploration is a key aspect of Goat Simulator, and the game's open-world environment is a playground of wacky surprises. From causing havoc in a quaint suburban neighborhood to wreaking havoc in a bustling city or even outer space, there's no shortage of bizarre scenarios to discover. The game encourages you to experiment, combining unlikely objects and interactions to create even more chaos.

The developers' commitment to embracing the absurd extends to the game's attention to detail. From the quirky physics engine to the intentionally humorous glitches, it's evident that Goat Simulator is a labor of love designed to tickle your funny bone. The game's tongue-in-cheek references to pop culture and gaming tropes add an extra layer of humor for those in the know.

While Goat Simulator may not be for everyone, it's a refreshing break from traditional gaming norms. It's a reminder that games can be purely fun and downright silly, providing an experience that is both entertaining and stress-relieving. So, if you're ready to let loose, embrace the madness, and embark on a hilarious adventure as a goat with no limits, Goat Simulator is waiting to whisk you away on a wild, unforgettable ride.

Por último, agregá las arvejas y condimentá a gusto.

138164837.review:
Goat Simulator is an absolute gem that defies all expectations. It embraces its own absurdity and delivers an experience that is both hilarious and thoroughly entertaining. Prepare yourself for a wild ride as you step into the hooves of a mischievous goat, ready to wreak havoc and explore a world of limitless possibilities.

First and foremost, the freedom and creativity in Goat Simulator are unparalleled. Want to launch yourself into the sky using a trampoline? Go for it! Feel like headbutting unsuspecting pedestrians or causing chaos in a coffee shop? You can do that too! The game encourages experimentation and rewards you for embracing the absurdity of it all. There's no shortage of ridiculous stunts and laugh-out-loud moments waiting to be discovered.

The open-world environment of Goat Simulator is surprisingly detailed and filled with hidden secrets and quirky challenges. From the bustling streets to the serene countryside, there's always something new to stumble upon. The developers' attention to detail is commendable, as even the tiniest interactions can yield unexpected and hilarious results.

The physics-based gameplay adds an extra layer of comedic brilliance. The intentionally wonky physics engine enhances the comedic value of every action you take. Whether you're sliding across the ground, flinging objects with your goat horns, or launching yourself into the distance, the unpredictable nature of the physics system ensures that no two moments are ever the same.

Goat Simulator's sense of humor is infectious. From tongue-in-cheek pop culture references to over-the-top scenarios, the game never takes itself too seriously. The hilarious glitches and intentional bugs add to the charm, creating moments that will leave you in stitches. The developers' commitment to delivering an enjoyable and humorous experience shines through every aspect of the game.

Additionally, the community support and modding scene surrounding Goat Simulator are exceptional. The game actively encourages players to create their own mods and share them with the community. This extends the game's lifespan and ensures that there's always fresh content to enjoy, from new goat skins to bizarre custom maps and challenges.

In conclusion, Goat Simulator is an absolute blast from start to finish. Its unique blend of open-world exploration, absurdity, and uncontrollable laughter make it a standout experience. Whether you're a fan of sandbox games, love quirky humor, or simply want to indulge in some mindless goat shenanigans, Goat Simulator is an absolute must-play. Embrace the chaos, let your inner goat run wild, and prepare to have an udderly amazing time!

Goat Simulator es un juego loco y divertido que recomendaría a cualquier persona que busque una experiencia de juego única y fuera de lo común. El juego es una simulación de cabra que te permite explorar un mundo abierto mientras creas el caos y la destrucción en tu camino.

Lo que realmente hace que Goat Simulator sea un juego excepcional es su humor y su estilo de juego irreverente. En resumen, Goat Simulator es un juego que recomendaría a cualquier persona que busque una experiencia de juego divertida, emocionante y fuera de lo común. Como no se Reseñar juegos aca les dejo la receta de un bizcochuelo casero y esponjoso
Ingredientes para cocinar un bizcochuelo casero (6 personas):

3 huevos

1 taza de aceite neutro

50ml de leche

1 taza de azúcar

2 tazas de harina 0000

1 cucharadita de polvo para hornear

ralladura de 1 limón o esencia de vainilla

azúcar glas

Paso a paso de la preparación: cómo cocinar bizcochuelo casero:

Batir el aceite neutro con el azúcar en un bol hasta que tome una consistencia blanda.

Añadir los 3 huevos. Mezclar muy bien hasta asegurarse de que quede bien incorporado.

Agregar la harina, leche y ralladura del limón/esencia de vainilla. Mezclar durante algunos minutos.

Tomar un molde, enmantecarlo y luego cubrirlo con un poco de harina. Esto es para que el bizcochuelo no se pegue.

Una vez que la mezcla quede homogénea, introducirla en el molde.

Prender el horno en una temperatura de 180º y poner el molde durante 45 minutos, aproximadamente.

Retirar el molde y esperar a que se enfríe durante varios minutos.

Una vez que el molde se termine de enfríar, retirar el bizcochuelo con cuidado.

Espolvorear con azúcar glas la superficie del bizcochuelo.

¡Listo! Ya tenés un fabuloso bizcochuelo casero para comer en familia o con amigos.

136454079.review:
"Goat Simulator" is a game that was released in 2014 and became very popular due to its unconventional gameplay and humorous elements. Here are some pros and cons of the game:

Pros:
1. Fun and silly gameplay: The game is designed to be fun and silly, and it definitely delivers in that regard. Players control a goat and are encouraged to cause chaos and destruction in a virtual world, which can be a lot of fun.
2. Humorous elements: The game is full of humorous elements, from the physics of the goat's movements to the various Easter eggs and references to other games and pop culture.
3. Replayability: The game is very replayable because every time you play, you can try to discover new things, complete new objectives, or just cause more chaos.

Cons:
1. Limited gameplay: The game has a limited amount of content, and while it can be fun to play for a little while, it may not keep players engaged for a long period of time.
2. Repetitive: The game can become repetitive after a while, as the objectives and gameplay mechanics are quite simple and there is not a lot of variety.
3. Glitches and bugs: The game is notorious for its glitches and bugs, which can sometimes make the game frustrating to play.

Overall, "Goat Simulator" is a fun and funny game that is definitely worth playing if you're in the mood for something silly and lighthearted. It has a great sense of humor and can provide a lot of entertainment, but it does have its limitations and can become repetitive after a while. If you're looking for a game that doesn't take itself too seriously and is just plain fun, then "Goat Simulator" might be the game for you.

135086502.review:
This game saved my life.

I am 47.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

135061803.review:
Goat Simulator is a hilarious and entertaining game that allows you to play as a goat and wreak havoc in a virtual world. The game was developed by Coffee Stain Studios and released in 2014, and it quickly became a viral sensation.

The gameplay in Goat Simulator is simple but incredibly fun. You control a goat and are free to roam around an open world environment, interacting with various objects and causing chaos. The game's physics engine is intentionally wonky, which makes for some truly hilarious moments as you watch your goat stumble and flail around.

One of the best parts of Goat Simulator is the sheer number of easter eggs and hidden surprises scattered throughout the game. From finding a jetpack to discovering a secret underground lair, there's always something new and unexpected to discover.

The graphics and sound design in Goat Simulator are intentionally low-fi, which adds to the game's charm. The game doesn't take itself too seriously, and this is reflected in its design.

Overall, Goat Simulator is a game that doesn't take itself too seriously and is all the better for it. If you're looking for a fun and silly game to play, Goat Simulator is definitely worth checking out.

Overall, a decent time-passer that you probably won't play for too long, but if it's on sale, you can get it cheap and entertain yourself with some goat humour for a bit.

135001063.review:
La reseña que estabas buscando

Goat Simulator es un videojuego de simulación lanzado en 2014 por Coffee Stain Studios. El juego se centra en el jugador asumiendo el papel de una cabra en un entorno de mundo abierto, con el objetivo de causar la mayor cantidad de caos y destrucción posible.

La premisa de Goat Simulator es bastante simple: el jugador controla una cabra y tiene total libertad para explorar el mundo del juego y causar estragos a su paso. El juego no tiene una trama o objetivo específico, lo que significa que los jugadores pueden hacer lo que quieran y jugar como quieran.

En cuanto a los gráficos, Goat Simulator tiene un estilo visual bastante sencillo pero efectivo, con entornos coloridos y caricaturescos que combinan bien con el tono humorístico del juego. El diseño de la cabra en sí misma es bastante detallado y está animado de manera realista, lo que le da al juego una sensación de autenticidad incluso en sus momentos más absurdos.

En cuanto a la jugabilidad, Goat Simulator es bastante fácil de entender. El jugador puede mover a la cabra usando las teclas de flecha y realizar una variedad de acciones, desde saltar y correr hasta golpear cosas y cabecear objetos en el entorno. Además, la cabra también tiene la capacidad de extender su lengua para agarrar objetos y arrastrarlos, lo que puede ser útil para causar caos adicional.

Una de las principales atracciones de Goat Simulator son las misiones y desafíos ocultos que se encuentran en todo el mundo del juego. Estos desafíos pueden ir desde simples tareas como saltar sobre trampolines hasta misiones más complicadas que involucran navegar por un laberinto. Completar estas misiones y desafíos otorga al jugador puntos y desbloquea nuevos elementos y áreas en el juego.

En general, Goat Simulator es un juego divertido y único que no toma nada en serio. Si bien puede no ser para todos, es una experiencia divertida y absurda que seguramente hará reír a los jugadores que disfrutan de la comedia y el caos.

134916490.review:
This game made quite a splash back when it was released, and at the time, my friends and I decided to hop on the bandwagon and play it as well. We had a few hours of fun and then proceeded to abandon this game for almost a decade. I decided to try it out again recently, and although I found it has some fun moments, it did not take long before the game once again turned from a funny joke to a tedious, repetitive experience.

For those that are not familiar with this game, it's a joke game that's designed to be intentionally unpolished and buggy. Although the game is full of jokes and references, most of the enjoyment of this game will likely come from the ridiculously janky physics and you'll likely find your goat being ejected into the stratosphere, while the model is stretched into something unrecognizable more than once. However, the unstable nature of the game is a double-edged sword. You will almost certainly find times when this will be annoying or tedious as well, when a physics bug sends you flying during some tricky platforming, when you find a hidden area only to get stuck inside the floor, or when you get too many abilities and it makes the game completely unplayable. This is pretty frustrating, especially if you're trying to actually complete a specific quest or achievement.

The game also isn't very replayable as there just isn't much content. Sure, it's fun to explore the three included maps the first time around, but it doesn't take long to go everywhere and do everything, and then there just isn't much else to do, unless you enjoy running around harassing NPCs and breaking the same things over and over. The lack of content combined with the janky controls and buggy nature of the game made it overstay it's welcome pretty quickly. Even though the game is priced fairly low now, it still feels like it's too much for a game that doesn't seem to give you more than a few hours of enjoyment before it gets stale.

[b]TL;DR[/b] This intentionally buggy joke game about being a goat has some funny moments and can be fun to mess around in, but it's frustrating when the game breaks in ways that prevent you from completing or reaching something, which happens frequently, and there just isn't that much content for the price, so I wouldn't recommend it, unless this sounds like something you're ok with and you can get it on a good sale.

134730297.review:
All my life I have been empty. The doctors could not tell me why I was so depressed, and I never knew myself until today. I needed to experience my life as a goat. Goat Simulator has filled the void in my life.

I knew as soon as I hit the truck with my goat that this was what I had been missing. I flew through the air in slow motion, tongue flying around, hitting the edge of the map and rebounding back, landing on (and falling through) the roof of a house. I could not get out, but that did not matter. I was treated with the ability to look down into the house beneath me, seeing the unsuspecting people casually sitting at their computers, oblivious to the sheer terror of the goat above them.

Whether it was playing football with a basketball, swinging lampposts into groups of people or even doing 1080 degree flips, there was no limit to life as a goat. I didn't think it could get any better than this.

I was wrong.

As I jumped and screamed my way around the map, leaving a path of destruction in my wake, I happened upon a golden statue. Curiosity overtook me and I resisted the urge to grab it no longer. My life as a goat changed completely. I had a jetpack.

I knew that this was meant to be, and what my mission from the Great Coffee Stain in the sky was. I was granted the supergoat power of being able to lift people and cars with my tongue. I could survive any impact. I could slow down time with mere thought. Now I could fly. It was time for world domination. Humanity had to be silenced so that the new goat overlords could reign supreme.


All the humans are dead or enslaved. I have won. I am the goat, the goat is me.

Go and goat this game. I kid you not, for mere bucks you can experience a sandbox like no other. Destruction, mayhem, death defying stunts. Seriously, there are more than 921 million goats in the world. Killing the humans was just part of the game. This is a SIMULATOR. Do you understand? A SIMULATOR. This can happen. There are enough goats out there to enslave us and/or kill us.

It is your duty as a human to get this game, so that you may truly know your enemy. An enemy people do not take seriously, an enemy that we know nothing about. Coffee Stain studios have granted us the insight into the true terrifying reality of the impending Goatpocalypse. This is your weapon against the goats. Be prepared, for the goats are coming to get us.

[h1][b]Introduction[/b][/h1]
Goat Simulator is a popular video game developed by Coffee Stain Studios and released in 2014. The game has become widely known for its wacky and unconventional gameplay, which involves controlling a goat in a fully interactive open world. The game's premise is simple: players take on the role of a goat and are free to roam around a suburban environment, interacting with objects and causing chaos wherever they go. While the game's graphics are intentionally low-fi and cartoonish, the gameplay and overall experience of Goat Simulator have captured the hearts of gamers worldwide.


[h1][b]Gameplay review - 8/10[/b][/h1]
Goat Simulator's gameplay is both silly and addictive. Players control a goat with a variety of different abilities, such as headbutting, jumping, and even licking objects to make them stick to the goat's tongue. The open world of Goat Simulator is also filled with numerous interactive elements, from trampolines to vehicles, that players can use to create mayhem and destruction. The game's physics engine is intentionally buggy, making the experience even more unpredictable and entertaining. While some players may find the gameplay repetitive after a while, the sheer absurdity of the game's premise and the creative ways that players can interact with the environment make Goat Simulator a unique and enjoyable experience.


[h1][b]Graphics review - 5/10[/b][/h1]
Goat Simulator's graphics are intentionally low-fi and cartoonish, which adds to the game's overall charm. The game's textures are simple and blocky, but the character models and animations are fluid and responsive. The game's physics engine also plays a significant role in the game's visuals, as objects can be thrown around and destroyed in amusing ways. While Goat Simulator's graphics may not be the most realistic or visually impressive, they serve the game's purpose perfectly and add to the overall fun and lighthearted tone.


[h1][b]Entertainment review - 10/10[/b][/h1]
Goat Simulator's entertainment value cannot be overstated. The game's ridiculous premise and unpredictable gameplay make it a joy to play. Players can spend hours exploring the open world and discovering new ways to cause chaos and destruction. The game's humorous and self-aware tone also adds to the entertainment factor, as the game is not meant to be taken seriously. The game's developers have also released several DLCs that add new goats, areas, and gameplay mechanics, which keep the game fresh and engaging.


[h1][b]Final review - 7.6/10[/b][/h1]
In conclusion, Goat Simulator is a unique and entertaining game that is well worth playing. While the game's graphics may not be the most impressive, they serve the game's purpose perfectly and add to the overall charm. The gameplay is both silly and addictive, and players can spend hours exploring the open world and causing chaos in creative ways. The game's self-aware and humorous tone also adds to the overall experience, making Goat Simulator a refreshing and fun game to play. Whether you're a fan of simulation games or just looking for a lighthearted and entertaining experience, Goat Simulator is a game that you won't want to miss.

Достаточно сложно описать данную игру ведь она просто какой-то один мем. Помню играл в эту игру в детстве, но потом забросил, решил недавно вернуться чтобы оценить весь вышедший контент и это бесподобно.

Начну с графики, конечно её не помешало бы обновить для более современных стандартов, да и в принципе на современных машинах она может тормозить или вылетать, как было у меня. Несмотря на это для такой игры всё равно графика остаётся как память для ностальгии.

Геймлей в целом интересный и очень разнообразный, я даже понятие не имел как одна коза способно устроить геноцид человечества или просто апокалипсис, даже есть специальные задания и достижения, которые помогают рассмотреть часть контента. если говорить проще то в геймлей фановый что игру и делает выделяющиеся на фоне остальных симуляторов.

Сюжета тут как такого нет, но и не нужно происходящее логически невозможно обосновать и игра на этом и строиться что не нужно тут вообще задавать вопросы, просто принять как должное.

По поводу ДЛС, они шикарные по наполненности контента и как вообще авторам удалось до такого додуматься, мммо, зомби, космос, воры. В ДЛС есть где разгуляться и каждое из них есть что предложить, как например убить демона, или покататься с помощью дельфина в инвалидном кресте, которое ездит по любой поверхности.

В заключение хочу сказать, что игру нужно пощупать самому ведь то что там происходит не хватит описаний. Я рекомендую игру любому игроку, порой нужно расслабиться от всего и чисто пофаниться, вы не пожалеете.

132245282.review:
Coffee Stain Studios did an amazing job when they assembled Goat Simulator. I’ve never experienced a game that fit the description of organised chaos so perfectly. At points the game feels like its falling apart as your goat glitches and lag spikes sore. All the while the atmosphere surrounding you is absolute anarchy. This is woven together by a plethora of pop culture references with comedic twists that act as some sort of story line. Somehow this unlikely combination works out seamlessly. My personal favourite of these ohmage’s had to be the appearance of the “Companion Cube” from Portal. 

Achievement wise this game is a completionists paradise. Every single action is rewarded with a cleverly named steam achievement that looks phenomenal as well. The DLC’s contain my personal favourite. 

Overall I think this game is amazing and I’m shocked that more people do not own this splendid game 😊

131796513.review:
Goat Simulator is an unusual and entertaining game that truly stands out among the crowded sea of simulation games available on the market today. This game is essentially what the name suggests: players take control of a goat and cause as much chaos and destruction as possible within the game's virtual environment.

The graphics are simple yet effective, featuring a whimsical and cartoony look that perfectly suits the game's overall tone. The controls are straightforward and easy to learn, allowing players to quickly get into the action and start causing some mayhem. The environment is wide open, giving players plenty of space to roam and wreak havoc, and the various obstacles and objects within the world are highly destructible, adding to the game's overall sense of humor and playfulness.

One of the things that really sets Goat Simulator apart from other simulation games is its humor. The game takes a tongue-in-cheek approach to its gameplay, never taking itself too seriously and always encouraging players to embrace their inner mischievous streak. The goat's antics are often ridiculous and absurd, and players are sure to find themselves laughing out loud as they cause all sorts of chaos and destruction within the game's world.

Another standout feature of Goat Simulator is its replayability. The game is highly random, meaning that no two play sessions are exactly alike. This means that players are always kept on their toes, never quite sure what will happen next and always finding new and creative ways to cause trouble. Additionally, the game's environment is highly interactive, encouraging players to experiment and try out new things, further increasing its replayability.

In conclusion, Goat Simulator is an excellent choice for anyone looking for a lighthearted and entertaining simulation game. It's unique approach to gameplay, combined with its sense of humor and high replayability, make it a game that is both fun and addictive. Whether you're looking for a quick laugh or a game to sink hours into, Goat Simulator is sure to deliver.

131024454.review:
GOAT SIMULATOR: CRÍTICA

Este obra de culto traída por las manos de Coffee Stain Studios y Microsoft Windows en abril de 2014 es un juego completamente indispensable para los admiradores del décimo arte, en una renovación del concepto de la simulación en el vídeojuego, que ya nos traían clásicos como Grand Theft Auto o  Harvest Moon. 
    En este juego poseemos a una nada especial cabra que brilla justamente, aunque parezca contradictorio, por su simpleza. Mientras poseemos a esta nada especial cabra podemos conocer esta ciudad en la cuál estamos inmersos, a través de los inocentes ojos de esta cabra. Pero esta mirada sobre el juego es falsa, ya que, aunque el personaje que poseamos sea esta cabra, los ojos que miran este mundo son los nuestros, por lo que podemos percibir aquello que nuestra compatriota del mundo animal no podría hacerlo. Y en este momento es cuándo Goat Simulator se vuelve genial. En escenarios aparentemente inocentes, se nos cuenta la real historia de este juego, que podemos considerar también la historia de nuestra sociedad. La de una sociedad enferma, que algunos tratan de evadir a través de, por ejemplo, como es mostrado en uno de los muchos rincones de esta nada singular ciudad, un hecho realmente singular, como lo es la presencia de asustadores rituales satánicos. Mientras controlamos a esta juguetona cabra, que no comprende los funcionamientos del comportamiento en sociedad (y a veces tampoco los de las leyes de la física), podemos arrasar todo lo que vemos a nuestra vista, en una especie de nihilismo jugable. Pero en nuestras muchas y constantes arrasadas de territorio, podemos también prestar atención a la simple (quitando la singular existencia de una especie de sitio dedicada al ritual, que podemos usar como centro de sacrificios humanos para una entidad demoníaca) ciudad que destruimos constantemente. Esta ciudad es como cualquier sociedad del mundo occidental moderno: centrada en los conceptos de la familia nuclear, el patriarcado y las leyes de la oferta y la demanda. Pero sería cínico de mi parte hablar de la sociedad moderna occidental, como si yo tampoco fuera parte de ella. Yo, y muy probablemente usted, lector, también es parte de esta cultura. Y, escribiendo desde las cercanías a las alcantarillas en el Oeste de la ciudad de Calí, pero que podrían ser también las de Buenos Aires, las de Rio de Janeiro, las de Nueva York o las de Quebec, que esta sociedad enferma sigue mostrando lo que tantos criticaron en el siglo pasado, ahí es cuando bajo de la estación y veo que un empresario saudí lleva una cabra a todos lados. En ese momento mi mente revive aquellas horas gastadas en aquel juego que me había regalado mi colega Juan Pedro de Valdivia, conocido en Steam como jesus es de boca99 como parte de una estúpida broma. Fumé y recordé los hechos recientes del mundo, la invasión del Capitolio, la aparición de Joe Biden como presidente de los Estados Unidos, la Guerra de Ucrania o el fin de la carrera de Mia Khalifa. Lloré, y recordé las sabias palabras de jesus es de boca99: "ph es peor que xvid". Cuando volví a casa, jugué de nuevo, pero con otros ojos. Ojos llorosos ante tal obra. 10/10

-esta critica no e tenido la fortuna de formularla yo mismo, la a creado Stendjdorf mi cercano y gran compadre.

Gallo Pinto Costarricense

Ingredientes
3 cucharadas de aceite de canola
1/4 cebolla picada
1/2 pimiento verde (o rojo) en cuadraditos
3 tazas de frijoles rojos o negros, cocidos
3 tazas de arroz blanco, cocido
1. pizca de Sal
2 cucharadas de culantro picado

Instrucciones
1. Calienta el aceite en una sartén grande y fríe la cebolla y el pimiento hasta que estén suaves.

3. Incorpora el arroz y sigue friendo unos tres minutos más agregando un poco más de caldo de frijoles para que el gallo pinto no quede muy seco y finalmente adorna con culantro picado.

129218054.review:
Goat Simulator is the most chaotic, and most hilarious, game ever created. You play as a goat who, with the help of a few simple controls, can cause absolute mayhem in its open world environment. Whether you're running through the streets, smashing cars, or licking everything in sight, there's never a dull moment in this game.

The best part? You get to do it all as a goat. From making loud bleats to headbutting unsuspecting pedestrians, this goat knows how to have a good time. Even the most mundane tasks become exciting when you're a goat. Who knew mowing the lawn could be so fun?

Goat Simulator is the perfect game for anyone who loves a good laugh. Who could resist the chaos of a goat running wild? After all, if there's one thing goats are known for, it's getting into trouble. So why not join in on the fun?

129009168.review:
Queque de chocolate

INGREDIENTES

2 1/2 tazas de harina
1 1/2 tazas de azúcar granulada
1 taza de chocolate en polvo
2 cucharaditas de polvos de hornear
1/2 cucharadita de bicarbonato de sodio
1/2 cucharadita de sal fina
1 taza de aceite vegetal
1 taza de leche fría
2 huevos
1 cucharadita de esencia de vainilla
INSTRUCCIONES
Precalentar el horno a 350°F (180°C)
Mezclar en un bol la harina, azúcar granulada, chocolate en polvo, polvos de hornear, bicarbonato y sal. Formar una corona y vaciar en el centro la mezcla del aceite, leche, huevos y esencia de vainilla.
Mezclar todo muy bien.
Vaciar a un molde enmantequillado y regado con sémola.
Cocer apróximadamente unos 35 minutos. Antes de sacar del horno revisar que este completamente cocido con la ayuda de un palito de brocheta. Si éste sale seco es porque está listo.
GANACHE:
Derretir en una olla ,227 grs de chocolate semidulce de cobertura a baño maria, agregar 3/4 taza (180 ml) de crema líquida y agregar finalmente 2 cucharadas (28 grs.) de mantequilla sin sal. Unir bien hasta que este todo derretido el chocolate.
Cuando el queque este frío, rociar encima de éste el ganache recién hecho.

128323340.review:
La «chocotorta» es uno de los postres más conocidos en las casas argentinas, junto con los alfajores y los panqueques muy popular en los años 80, se hizo muy famosa sobre todo en los pueblos del sur de Santa Fe, Se comenzó a elaborar el postre de las chocolinas pues era muy fácil de hacer, no necesita horno y se mezclan ingredientes ya comprados, perfecta para cualquier celebración.

Sin embargo, es poco frecuente encontrarlo en los restaurantes pues es más como la tarta de la abuela, una tarta casera que se prepara para los cumpleaños. Una torta que esta inspirada en el tiramisú italiano, su preparación es muy sencilla, ya que al estar todos sus ingredientes principales «pre hechos», no requiere cocción alguna.

Se hace con unas galletas de chocolate “chocolinas”, muy parecidas a las Oceanix, aunque resultan un poco más amargas al tener más concentración de cacao, pero eso también, es lo que hace que el contraste con el dulce de leche sea ideal.

Aunque la receta original de la chocotorta es la que os voy a mostrar a continuación, es cierto, que pronto aparecieron otras versiones de tartas de galletas, por ejemplo, empapando las galletas en licores como el Oporto, o en almíbar… o las decoraciones de la capa superior puede ser de lo más variada desde piñones a confituras. ​Aquí tienes la base de la receta más tradicional en Argentina, pero como siempre os digo, al gusto de cada casa. Tu chocotarta a tu manera. ¿Te animas a prepararla?

Preparación de la chocotorta argentina

    En un bol batimos juntos, el queso y el dulce de leche hasta conseguir una crema lisa y homogénea. Para que quede mejor, utiliza una batidora de varilla. Reservamos tapado en la nevera.
    En la receta original se mojaban las galletas en Oporto y utilizaban para la mezcla de relleno partes iguales de dulce de leche y Mendicrim, una crema de queso argentina. Podéis hacerlo en casa, con Oporto, café o café con un poquito de licor, leche o leche con cacao (si la van a comer los peques de casa. En nuestro caso hemos optado por café.
    Preparamos el café, si van a comer esta tarta es mejor que sea café descafeinado (podéis emplear café soluble también, de vuestra marca preferida). Echamos el café en un cuenco y bañamos en él las galletas, durante 3 ó 4 segundos.
    Al ser las galletas cuadradas, lo ideal es usar un molde cuadrado o rectangular, y vamos colocando las galletas formando una base. A continuación, extendemos la mezcla de queso y dulce de leche que teníamos reservada, creando una capa y cubrimos de nuevo con otra capa de galletas mojadas en café.
    Vamos formando capas, al menos tres, terminando la tarta con una capa de crema de queso con dulce de leche. Por último, decoramos con el cacao rallado o con virutas de chocolate o de colores. En nuestro caso, hemos empleado una manga pastelera para aprovechar lo que sobraba de relleno y así que tuviese una pinta de rechupete.
    Reservamos en la nevera al menos 12 horas antes de consumirla. De hecho, está mucho más buena, de un día para otro.

Sigue los pasos de esta deliciosa receta de chocotorta argentina en el álbum. No os perdáis detalle para que os salga perfecta.
Consejos para una chocotorta perfecta

    En esta tarta hemos empleado galletas de chocolate Chocolinas, que son las más consumidas para preparar la auténtica Chocotorta, las podéis encontrar en España en tiendas especializadas de comida latina o en tiendas online como Amazon. Pero sino también valen galletas finitas de chocolate como las Oceanix de Tosta Rica o incluso galletas sin gluten por si hay algún celíaco en casa.
    Las Chocolinas nacen en Argentina en 1975 y suelen tener mucho sabor a chocolate, menos dulces que las de Tosta Rica, que se compensa con el sabor del dulce de leche, que hacer que sea una tarta equilibrada y bestial, de las que más me gustan.
